result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Sheedy, Wanda G.
defendant.address: W7992 Division Street, Park Falls, WI 54552

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:24 AM Court calls case. Da Kelz states appearances. Defendant Wanda G. Sheedy in court.  Attorney Luke J Fischer Sr. in court for Wanda G. Sheedy.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. DA Kelz states a pretrial has been conducted but a resolution is still being worked out. Attorney Fischer states a plea and sentencing can be set. Parties are ordered to contact the judicial assistant to set that date.
Motion hearing on October 17, 2022 at 10:15 am.

11:30 AM DA calls case and states appearances. Defendant Wanda G. Sheedy in court.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Luke J Fischer Sr. in court for Wanda G. Sheedy. DA kelz states this matter has been set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Fischer states his client would like to waive the preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant in regards to the waiver. Defendant gives responses. Court questions Attorney Fischer as to the waiver. Attorney Fischer gives responses. Preliminary Hearing waived.  Waiver accepted by the Court. Court finds probable cause exists that a crime was committed and binds DE over for trial. Information filed, acknowledged by parties and reading waived. Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts. Adj 11:35 AM
Preliminary hearing on July 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on July 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency
Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency

10:36 AM Defendant Wanda G. Sheedy appeared in court. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.   Notice of right to attorney given to DE.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived. DA Kelz states bond already set. Court orders bond to continue.
Demand for discovery notice of intent to use DNA
Petition for appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of indigency

11:00 AM DA calls case and states appearances and possible charges. Defendant appeared via video from Price County Jail. DE next court date is  03/29/22 at 10 am.  Jail gives DE a notice of right to attorney.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation. Bond ordered as requested.
